author: Sam Yarwood
title: Arsonists target popular park bandstand
text:
Arsonists target popular park bandstand The Friends of Queen's Park say they are devastated by the blaze at the Heywood beauty spot Share Arson attack on the Queen's Park bandstand in Heywood (Photo: Steve Allen) Share Get     
Police are investigating after an open air theatre was targeted by arsonists. 
Fire crews were called to Queen’s Park in Heywood on Monday evening to reports of a blaze in the store room of the band stand. 
It is believed an accelerant was placed under the door and set alight, and firefighters remained at the scene for four hours. 
The structure was taped off on Tuesday morning due to it being unsafe. 
Lol Richardson, events organiser for the Friends of Queen’s Park , said it has come as a huge blow to the community. 
He said: “It’s absolutely devastating. 
“We don’t know how long it will be before it will be back up and running, we don’t even know if it can be saved or if it will have to be rebuilt yet. “We have been told it’s unsafe at the moment, the fire fighters had to smash their way in, then cut a hole in the roof for the smoke to escape. 
“It’s such a shame, there’s been very little trouble in the park over the last 10 years and this is the first time something like this has happened. 
“We have been told there were people playing music on the band stand at around 5.30pm last night, we don’t know if they had something to do with it, or if they may have seen something, but I’d ask anyone with information to get in touch with police. 
“As far as we know, no one has any problems with the park, some idiots have done this because they were bored and had nothing better to do.” The Queen's Park bandstand in Heywood before it was attacked by arsonists 
Lol, 58, explained the theatre tends to host around two events a month. Read More 
“We hold music festivals and on Sundays brass bands perform. Loads of people get involved and come along to see. 
“We won’t cancel what we have planned, we will find a way around it somehow.” 
A spokesman for GMFRS said: “We were called at 6.35pm to Queen’s Park in Heywood to reports of a fire involving store room in the bandstand. 
“We sent two crews from Rochdale and Heywood and they remained at the scene for around four hours.” 
GMP confirmed the incident was now being investigated as arson. 
Anyone with information is asked to contact police on 101, or anonymously by calling Crimestoppers on 0800 555 111. Like us on Facebook
